intro: Hieracium rhamphodon, commonly known as the beak-horn hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium rhamphodon is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
